ayush matters relating to the employees of ministry of ayush and its organizations others ayush institute institute for teaching and research in ayurveda gujarat ppo no sub request for prioritizing the conglomeration process for permanent employees of itra formerly known as sgam respected sir we hope this letter finds you well we the undersigned are regular employees of formerly known as shri gulabkunverba ayurveda mahavidyalaya sgam which have been integrated into the institute of teaching and research in ayurveda itra under the itra act we appreciate the smooth transition facilitated by the administration and the opportunities provided to email however we have some concerns regarding our promotional prospects and employment status we respectfully request your assistance with the following matters equal opportunities and benefits we request that former sgam employees be granted equal opportunities and benefits as their email we also seek alignment of the employment status of all former sgam employees at the earliest opportunity clarifying our employment status would provide job security and allow us to focus more effectively on our professional responsibilities consideration for promotions we request that the qualifications experience and contributions of former sgam employees be duly considered for promotions several employees have been in their respective roles for extended periods without promotion a transparent and fair promotion policy would be highly appreciated grievance redressal mechanism we have faced significant economic and professional challenges due to delays in addressing these issues attached are the academic profiles of all permanent teaching staff members who possess to years of academic experience but are not receiving the appropriate pay scales or positions we request the expedited completion of the conglomeration process additionally we suggest establishing a dedicated grievance redressal mechanism to address the concerns of former sgam employees this would provide a platform for employees to voice their issues

central board of direct taxes income tax direct taxes issues with it returns rectification pan no assessment year chargeoffice not provided regional office office dgitsystems cpc e filing subject request for condonation of short deduction demand qb ack no al respected sirmadam i ravindra srikanth recently purchased a property and accordingly filed form qb for tds compliance since i was not well versed with tax laws i engaged a tax consultant to assist with the filing however i later became aware that the seller ms r jayashree pan had an inoperative pan due to its non linkage with aadhaar upon realizing this we promptly linked the pan with aadhaar by paying the applicable late fee of subsequently after the processing of the tds statement a demand notice was raised for a short deduction amounting to the short deduction arose due to the inoperative status of the sellers pan at the time of filing which was entirely unintentional since the pan is now active and linked with aadhaar i kindly request the department to condone this mistake and reprocess the qb tds return acknowledgment no al so that the short deduction is nullified i sincerely request your kind consideration of this matter and an appropriate resolution at the earliest i would be grateful for your support and guidance in this regard thank you for your time and assistance best regards ravindra srikanth

central board of direct taxes income tax direct taxes issues with it returns tds mismatch tanpan financial yearassessment year ay ay reg regional office office others respected sir sub non deposit of tds on pan by tan lknsd for ay ay reg i wish to bring this matter in your honorable kind notice that i have been working in sahara india group since vide agency code and my tds has been deducted by sahara credit cooperative society limited vide tan lknsd but not deposited the same tds on my pan for the ay ay till date this society has complete details of my tds and the tds office of lucknow is also aware about itthe society has been deposited my tds from ay to but not deposited the same for the mentioned year ay ay whereas the society has deducted tds for the mentioned year also for the reference of income tax department i am sending my itr computation aadhar card form asmy pan card and sahara i cardsir form a amp tds certificate is not provided by employer currently kindly help me so that my tds could be deposited on my pan soon note sir i am filing rd cpgram on same issue but tds still not deposited by deducter amp when i file appeal then they said due to embargo on sahara group we are not depositing tds right now but there is no embargo on sahara group amp they are selling their properties in multiple states of india and we are not responsible for same if they have deducted tds on my income that it will be his duty to filing tds correction into my pan amp also their is no action has been taken by income tax department for not filing tds i am in financial crisis and demanding for my hard earned money please look into this matter seriously amp ask deducter for filing tds correction statement as soon as possible thanking you

central board of direct taxes income tax direct taxes tax policy matter suggestions pan no dear sir i would like to express my concerns regarding the new tax regime for fy as per the governments announcement individuals with taxable income up to lakh are exempt from paying income tax many of my colleagues fall under this category and will not be required to pay any tax on their income up to lakh which i wholeheartedly welcome however my taxable income for fy is lakh which means that due to a mere difference of in income i am being taxed on the entire lakh essentially i am being forced to pay tax on lakh which is exempt for my colleagues in the same income range this seems unfair to me and i would like to highlight that it feels unjust that only the small difference in income makes such a significant impact on my tax liability the government has made it clear that income up to lakh is tax exempt so it would seem logical and just to only levy tax on the amount above lakh this approach would be more rational and fair especially considering the relatively small difference in income moreover with the vast resources available to the government both directly and indirectly through various taxes i feel it is unnecessary to impose such taxation on individuals when a simple adjustment could make the system fairer it seems contradictory that people earning just more than the exempted threshold are being burdened with tax on the entire income including the portion that is otherwise exempt in conclusion i believe the government should reassess this approach and consider exempting taxes for all individuals earning up to lakh applying the tax only on the income exceeding this threshold this would promote fairness and rationality within the tax system and foster a more positive sentiment among taxpayers thank you for considering my concerns sincerely md miraz

societys day to day operations and are governed by the principle of mutuality as held in bangalore club v cit itr sc amounts received from members for mutual benefit are not taxable provided the contributors and beneficiaries are the same the receipts are utilized exclusively for the benefit of members and there is no profit motive against these receipts the society incurred rs as maintenance expenses hence these contributions do not constitute taxable income the society filed an updated return under section a with acknowledgment number on february correcting the income that was wrongly shown in the original and revised itrs filed earlier the actual income of the society is only rs consisting of interest from banks and clubhouse event receipts there is no other business receipt the societys taxable income includes rs from clubhouse events and rs as interest from banks totaling rs hence the society complied with all income tax provisions and paid the due taxes accordingly due to an inadvertent mistake maintenance receipts were shown as sale of services in the income tax return and an incorrect claim under section p was made we sincerely regret this unintentional error the society is subject to audit under the cooperative societies act and its audited financial statements clearly support the above computation in light of the above it is our humble request and prayer to kindly quash the outstanding

central board of direct taxes income tax direct taxes information about benami transaction regional office office region up east to the commissioner income tax department noida date subject complaint against ms retail junction pvt ltd c sector noida amp its director mr vineet mehta for gst fraud amp income tax evasion of approx crore dear sirmadam i shashank kumar former associate of ms retail junction pvt ltd am writing to formally report fraudulent gst transactions and income tax evasion carried out by the company and its director mr vineet mehta it has come to my notice that ms retail junction pvt ltd has been fraudulently obtaining purchase bills from multiple parties while receiving a cashback on the gst amount from them this systematic malpractice has allowed the company to claim fraudulent gst input credits significantly reducing its gst tax liabilities falsify business expenses using these fake purchase bills leading to substantial income tax evasion fraudulent transaction pattern a majority of these fraudulent purchase bills are generated in the first week of every month payments for these bills are made on the same day in advance or within a short time frame as the cashback including the gst amount is returned to mr vineet mehta this fraudulent practice has been ongoing for the past three years estimated tax evasion it is estimated that ms retail junction pvt ltd has processed approximately crore worth of fraudulent purchase bills leading to gst fraud of approximately lakh false input tax credit claims income tax evasion on crore due to falsified expenses resulting in significantly lower tax deposits i am attaching ledger details of all involved parties as supporting evidence of this fraudulent practice in light of this serious financial misconduct i urge the income tax department to initiate a thorough investigation into the fraudulent activities of ms retail junction pvt ltd and its director mr vineet mehtaimmediate

central board of excise and customs indirect taxes related central goods and service tax central excise service tax delay in adjudication order appeals gst state west bengal jurisdiction of the complainant zone commissionerate division raiganj gstin aahcmnz region kolkata zone gst subject request for modificationdrop of demand order passed by sri malay dey jcct reference case id adz respected sir i am writing to request the modification or dropping of the demand order issued under case id adz i would like to provide the following details for your consideration background of the case two case ids were created for the period due to discrepancies in the liability tax the first adm was raised by smt kaberi dutta dcr due to a difference between the turnover reported in gstr and gstr b the second adz was raised by sri malay dey jcct due to discrepancies between the turnover in as and gstr b payment of shortpaid liability the shortpaid liability of rs cgst rs sgst rs was paid through drc with arn ad dated based on this payment smt kaberi dutta dropped the first demand order however another notice for the same demand was issued by sri malay dey under reference no zdt on duplicate demand notices it is important to note that issuing two separate notices for the same demand is a mistake while i understand that a response was required i missed the opportunity due to confusion about the nature of the notices i became aware of the second notice only two months after it was raised and by then the window for filing an appeal had passed unfortunately due to financial to deputy commissioner dakshina kannada commissioner mangaluru city corporation mcc managing director mangaluru smart city limited mscl regional transport officer rto mangaluru superintendent of police sp dakshina kannada divisional controller ksrtc mangaluru dakshina kannada city bus owners association subject urgent need for full gps data integration in mangalurus public transport system respected authorities i am writing to bring to your immediate attention the lack of full gps data integration in mangalurus public transport system despite clear directives and the pressing need for a centralized tracking system in august the dakshina kannada city bus owners association initiated gps installations in city buses to enhance safety and operational efficiency in november the deputy commissioner mandated all bus operators including ksrtc to integrate their gps systems with the integrated command and control centre iccc however as of january nearly private buses continue to withhold their gps data from mangaluru smart city limited mscl delaying the implementation of a fully functional tracking system this non compliance is undermining public safety operational efficiency and mangalurus smart city goals the district administrations smart city mobile application designed to provide real time bus tracking will remain ineffective unless all operators comply with gps data sharing key concerns passenger safety real time tracking allows authorities to respond swiftly in emergencies operational efficiency a unified system ensures better fleet management and reliable services traffic amp environmental benefits optimized bus routes reduce congestion fuel consumption and emissions smart city implementation gps integration is a critical component of mangalurus modernization efforts demands for immediate action strict enforcement immediate measures must be taken against non compliant operators including penalties deadline for compliance set a firm deadline for gps data integration with clear consequences for failure public awareness amp accountability ensure transparency by informing the public about non compliant operators collaboration with technology providers remove cost related excuses by facilitating affordable gps solutions this issue requires urgent intervention from the deputy commissioner and relevant authorities it is unacceptable that corporate affairs others i am writing to you as a student of the icsi to express my concerns regarding the provisions of the new income tax bill concerning tax audit eligibility the bill as it currently stands restricts the conduct of tax audits to quotaccountantsquot a term that appears to be defined exclusively as chartered accountants this effectively excludes company secretaries cs and cost and management accountants cma from performing tax audits while i understand the importance of ensuring the competence and integrity of those conducting tax audits i believe the current provision overlooks the expertise and training that cs students and members possess during our icsi studies and mandatory internships before obtaining the membership certificate we receive comprehensive training in taxation accounting auditing and related financial subjectsthis rigorous curriculum equips us with the necessary skills and knowledge it is concerning that despite our demonstrated capabilities the bill does not recognize cs professionals as eligible to conduct tax audits this exclusion seems particularly unjustified given that cs professionals are also regulated by a professional body and adhere to a strict code of conduct this is not an isolated instance similar discrepancies exist in other legislations such as the securities laws and company law where exclusive rights should be granted to us as well if this is done then in the future students will not want to pursue cs or cmas or any other professional degrees as all rights are given to ca and we are not being treated equally i firmly believe that all professionals including cas css and cmas bring unique and valuable expertise to the table and should be given equal opportunities to contribute within their respective domains i respectfully request that you reconsider the provisions of the income tax bill and make the necessary amendments to include company secretaries as eligible professionals to conduct tax audits
